entry.title: How to Build Your Own Self Driving Toy Car
entry.summary:
Description

PyData DC 2016

I’ve spent the past 6 months building a self-driving toy car using a Raspberry Pi, OpenCV, and TensorFlow. If you’ve ever thought about building your own self-driving toy car, this presentation will help you avoid common pitfalls and shed light on important tradeoffs that you’ll have to weigh along the way. Building a live face recognition system in the blink of a very slow eye

In this hands-on tutorial we will build a live face recognition system from scratch with the use of the OpenCV methods. Since face recognition is the main goal of this tutorial we will form teams of 2-3 people and recognize the faces in a live feed. entry.title: Using OpenCV with Python and ROS
entry.summary:
Summary

Bill Mania and Eric Kinzle A brief presentation of using the OpenCV computer vision toolset with Python and ROS. Included at the end will be a demonstration of tracking a colored object using a camera with servo-driven pan and tilt capability.
